author: Special Correspondent
text:
Four persons, including a police inspector, died while over 250 took ill after consuming poisonous b hang during the Mahashivratri festival in two villages in North Gujarat.

Among those who were taken ill, around a dozen are still said to be critical and are being treated in various hospitals in Mehsana and Ahmedabad. Others have been discharged after two-day hospitalisation.

“Three persons died on Wednesday, while the police inspector died on Thursday at a private hospital in Ahmedabad. However, it is yet to be ascertained whether the inspector also died after consuming bhang ,” said a senior police official from Mehsana.

The incident occurred in Budasan and Karanpur villages in Mehsana district, where local temples prepared bhang prasad to be offered to devotees on Mahashivratri.

“Three deaths are confirmed due to consumption of bhang. Post-mortem examination will establish the cause of the death of the inspector,” Mehsana Collector Lochan Sehra told The Hindu .
title: Four die after taking ‘bhang’ in Gujarat
